bill_title: appropriate money for international trade representation and to declare an emergency.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to appropriate money for trade representation in China, and to declare an emergency. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby appropriated from the state general fund the sum of two hundred thousand dollars ($ 200,000 ), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Tourism and State Development to provide funding for international trade representation services to represent South Dakota companies and their products in the People's Republic of China. Section 2. The department shall use the funds appropriated in this Act to establish a coordinating effort for international trade. The goal of this effort is to assist South Dakota businesses in finding customers and/or suppliers in foreign countries by helping them access existing programs, introducing them to available resources including government programs, private consultants or other businesses currently doing business in targeted markets. The department shall: (1) develop the capability and resources necessary to provide representation for South Dakota companies and products on-site in the People's Republic of China; develop and promote the service within South Dakota to encourage use of the services of South Dakota companies; and provide a focal point of contact for South Dakota companies to facilitate the identification of appropriate services for their requirements whether through this state function or other resources, or for a contract with a group/organization outside state government; (2) Represent South Dakota companies in the People's Republic of China or coordinate those services available to South Dakota companies in-state. The department shall use the following as a scope of work for the program and as criteria for a job description or for a successful bid for a contract. The successful applicant shall have experience in similar functions and activities and demonstrate the ability to: (1) Identify channels of communication and distribution of information about the program including chambers of commerce, industry associations, other government agencies, development organizations and individual companies; (2) Use these channels to develop direct contact with companies interested in finding customers or suppliers in foreign countries; (3) Help interested South Dakota businesses contact existing programs designed to assist with international trade; (4) Assist South Dakota companies in developing international marketing plans for specific markets; (5) Identify niche markets in South Dakota that have receptive foreign markets, develop an awareness of these opportunities among those businesses; (6) Advise companies on market entry strategies with an emphasis on learning about regional differences within target area counties; (7) Advise South Dakota companies and state officials on specific laws, regulations, trade barriers and related issues for visiting to develop business relationships; (8) Maintain a calendar of events for specific trade shows, seminars or other related activities that match well with interested South Dakota companies; (9) Help South Dakota businesses evaluate prospective international business partners; (10) Help businesses and officials with arrangements including securing visas, translators, drivers, etc.; (11) Conduct periodic meetings and seminars for interested businesses to provide information on trade and links to programs and mentors. Section 3. The secretary of the Department of Tourism and State Development shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 4. Whereas, this Act is necessary for the support of the state government and its existing public institutions, an emergency is hereby declared to exist, and this Act shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage and approval.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to appropriate money for international trade representation and to declare an emergency. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby appropriated from the state general fund the sum of two hundred thousand dollars ($ 200,000 ), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Tourism and State Development to provide for international trade representation services to represent and promote South Dakota international business development. Section 2. The department shall use the funds appropriated in this Act to establish a coordinating effort for international trade and business development. The goal of this effort is to assist South Dakota businesses in finding customers, suppliers, and investors in foreign countries by helping them access existing programs, introducing them to available resources including government programs, private consultants or other businesses currently doing business in targeted markets. The department shall: (1) Develop the capability and resources necessary to provide representation for South Dakota business development in foreign countries; develop and promote services within South Dakota to encourage use of the services of South Dakota companies; and provide a focal point of contact for South Dakota companies to facilitate the identification of appropriate services for their requirements whether through this state function or other resources, or for a contract with a group or organization outside state government; (2) Provide South Dakota business development services internationally or coordinate those services available to South Dakota companies in-state. The department may use the following as a scope of work for the program and as criteria for a job description or for a successful bid for a contract. The successful applicant shall have experience in similar functions and activities and demonstrate the ability to: (1) Identify channels of communication and distribution of information about the program including chambers of commerce, industry associations, other government agencies, development organizations and individual companies; (2) Use these channels to develop direct contact with companies interested in finding customers or suppliers in foreign countries; (3) Help interested South Dakota businesses contact existing programs designed to assist with international trade; (4) Assist South Dakota companies in developing international marketing plans for specific markets; (5) Identify niche markets in South Dakota that have receptive foreign markets, develop an awareness of these opportunities among those businesses; (6) Advise companies on market entry strategies with an emphasis on learning about regional differences within target area counties; (7) Advise South Dakota companies and state officials on specific laws, regulations, trade barriers and related issues for visiting to develop business relationships; (8) Maintain a calendar of events for specific trade shows, seminars or other related activities that match well with interested South Dakota companies; (9) Help South Dakota businesses evaluate prospective international business partners; (10) Help businesses and officials with arrangements including securing visas, translators, and transportation; (11) Conduct periodic meetings and seminars for interested businesses to provide information on trade and links to programs and mentors. Section 3. The secretary of the Department of Tourism and State Development shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 4. Whereas, this Act is necessary for the support of the state government and its existing public institutions, an emergency is hereby declared to exist, and this Act shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage and approval.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to appropriate money for international trade representation and to declare an emergency. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby appropriated from the state general fund the sum of one dollar ($ 1 ), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Tourism and State Development to provide for international trade representation services to represent and promote international business development for South Dakota. Section 2. The department shall use the funds appropriated in this Act to establish a coordinating effort for international trade and business development. The goal of this effort is to assist South Dakota businesses in finding customers, suppliers, and investors in foreign countries by helping them access existing programs, introducing them to available resources including government programs, private consultants or other businesses currently doing business in targeted markets. The department shall: (1) Develop the capability and resources necessary to provide representation for South Dakota business development in foreign countries; develop and promote services within South Dakota to encourage use of the services of South Dakota companies; and provide a focal point of contact for South Dakota companies to facilitate the identification of appropriate services for their requirements whether through this state function or other resources, or for a contract with a group or organization outside state government; (2) Provide South Dakota business development services internationally or coordinate those services available to South Dakota companies in-state. The department may use the following as a scope of work for the program and as criteria for a job description or for a successful bid for a contract. The successful applicant shall have experience in similar functions and activities and demonstrate the ability to: (1) Identify channels of communication and distribution of information about the program including chambers of commerce, industry associations, other government agencies, development organizations and individual companies; (2) Use these channels to develop direct contact with companies interested in finding customers or suppliers in foreign countries; (3) Help interested South Dakota businesses contact existing programs designed to assist with international trade; (4) Assist South Dakota companies in developing international marketing plans for specific markets; (5) Identify niche markets in South Dakota that have receptive foreign markets, develop an awareness of these opportunities among those businesses; (6) Advise companies on market entry strategies with an emphasis on learning about regional differences within target area counties; (7) Advise South Dakota companies and state officials on specific laws, regulations, trade barriers and related issues for visiting to develop business relationships; (8) Maintain a calendar of events for specific trade shows, seminars or other related activities that match well with interested South Dakota companies; (9) Help South Dakota businesses evaluate prospective international business partners; (10) Help businesses and officials with arrangements including securing visas, translators, and transportation; (11) Conduct periodic meetings and seminars for interested businesses to provide information on trade and links to programs and mentors. Section 3. The secretary of the Department of Tourism and State Development shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 4. Whereas, this Act is necessary for the support of the state government and its existing public institutions, an emergency is hereby declared to exist, and this Act shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage and approval.
